These stable composition values are similar to those obtained in other works, which synthesize CuFe 2O 4 nanoparticles by similar methods.
22, 23, 32 Even though the maximum reported purities in these works (95%) are slightly lower than ours, it is worth mentioning that these studies used maximum calcination temperatures of 800 °C, whereas our second batch is prepared at a calcination temperature of 850 °C. As it has been clearly demonstrated in this study, this difference in temperature can lead to an increase of ferrite conversion. On the other hand, all works agree on the formation of the tetragonal phase of CuFe 2O 4 in the studied temperature range.
